title: Does history lie in the Battle of Zama (202 BC)? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s no reason to believe it does. We do know beyond a reasonable doubt that Carthage fell and Rome ruled the Mediterranean. So, there are three possibilities; the entire historical record of the Roman Republic was an elaborate lie based on some grand conspiracy; history is correct about the Battle of Zama; there are minor factual errors meant to aggrandize the Romans that don’t really matter. You can pick the one that sounds most likely.
